title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is differentiable and increasing on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has exactly two points of inflection on this interval. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins at the origin. It moves gradually upward and to the right at first while concave down. At the point where x equals approximately 3, the curve starts to move upward and to the right while concave up. At the point where x equals approximately 5, the curve moves upward and to the right while concave down until it begins to level off and ends above the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves upward and to the right while concave down, crosses the x axis, and begins to level off as it reaches a maximum at a point above the x axis where x equals 3. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis at 5, at which point it moves concave up and ends at a point below the x axis.

The figure presents the graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The graph consists of two curves. The first curve begins at the origin. It moves upward and to the right while concave down and levels off as it reaches a maximum at a point above the x axis where x equals 2.5. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends at a point just above the x axis where x equals 4.5. The second curve begins at the point where the first curve ends, and moves upward and to the right while concave down until it ends at a point high above the x axis.

The figure presents the graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The graph consists of two curves. The first curve begins on the y axis, above the origin, and moves upward and to the right while concave down until it levels off and reaches a maximum above the x axis where x equals 1.3. It then moves downward and to the right until approximately x equals 2 when it begins to move concave up. It then levels off and reaches a minimum above the x axis where x equals 3. The curve then moves upward and to the right until it ends high above the x axis where x equals 5. The second curve begins where the first curve ends, and moves downward and to the right while concave up. It begins to level off and ends above the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The graph consists of two curves. The first curve begins at the origin. It moves upward and to the right while concave down and levels off as it reaches a maximum at a point above the x axis where x equals 2.5. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends at a point just above the x axis where x equals 4.5. The second curve begins at the point where the first curve ends, and moves upward and to the right while concave down until it ends at a point high above the x axis.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
